Sustained water extinguish path. Requires an external water system to invoke IWaterInteractable.WaterHit(Vector3) repeatedly such that currentHitInterval < maxHitInterval (2s) between hits, and accumulated currentHitTime >= totalHitTime (5s). Then Update() sets isOn=false and UpdateFireState(true) stops ParticleSystem, notifies neighbors via NotifyNeighborState(false), and calls FireController.Instance.FireChanged(-1). This GameObject has a BoxCollider and no Rigidbody; no public no-arg methods exist to trigger manually.

Because Fire exposes no public no-arg methods, we need a wrapper UnityEvent (m_Calls) or helper no-arg method to invoke WaterHit(Vector3) repeatedly every <2s for at least 5s to cover the turn-off branch. Expected: isTurningOff toggles true on first hit; currentHitInterval resets on each hit; after >=5s cumulative currentHitTime, fire turns off (isOn=false), shouldTurnOn=false, timeToOnDelta=0, UpdateFireState(true) triggers ParticleSystem.Stop(), neighbor notifications, and FireController.Instance.FireChanged(-1).

Validate neighbor-induced turn-on path. Same MonoBehaviour (GUID: 1729fd01c90a64d5b8037e1eef0d000d) with onNeighborsThreshold=2, minNeighborDownDistance=3, downMultiplier=2, maxNeighborDistance=4. Scene has neighbors=[] and FindNeighbors is not called, so we need a wrapper UnityEvent (m_Calls) or helper no-arg method to either: (a) call NotifyNeighborState(true) twice to reach threshold; or (b) set shouldTurnOn=true directly. Then wait ~timeToOn (serialized 3s) to cover the shouldTurnOn -> isOn transition. Expected: fire turns on (isOn=true), timers reset, UpdateFireState(true) triggers ParticleSystem.Play(), neighbor notifications, and FireController.Instance.FireChanged(1). If any down neighbor is configured (>3 units below), verify accelerated countdown via downMultiplier.
